intro: Pentacalia robertii, commonly known as the Robert's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Pentacalia robertii is often found in wetlands and is considered a valuable component of its native ecosystem.
